original: Calderon, Olof Harald, direktör, Göteborg, f. 4/11/08 i Visby av Alfred C. o. Alma Nilsson. G. 39 m. Eva Sjöberg. Barn: Kerstin f. 40, Karin o. Inger 46. —• Genomg. Brunnsviks folkhögsk., LOs sk., nord. folkhögsk. i Genève, Roskilde höj sk. Res. t. Tyskl., Schvi^eiz, Ital., Frankr.j Engl. o. de balt. länd. 36, Schweiz, Engl., Belg., Ital., Frankr., Holl. 47, de nord. länd. v. uppr. tillf. Omb :man i soc:-dem. arb :part., dir. i Lisebergs A-B i Gbg. Led. av stadsfullm. fr. 43, av drätselkamm., ordf. i Gbgs stads yr-kessk., led. av styr. f. Lisebergs A-B, suppl. i VingaboL, led. av styr. f. Hotell A-B Engelbrekt m. fl. Hobbies: fiske, reso^r.
translated: Calderon, Olof Harald, director, Gothenburg, born November 4th, 1908 in Visby to Alfred C. and Alma Nilsson. Married in 1939 to Eva Sjöberg. Children: Kerstin born in 1940, Karin and Inger born in 1946. He attended Brunnsviks Folk High School, LO's School, Nordic Folk High School in Geneva, and Roskilde Higher School. He traveled to Germany, Switzerland, Italy, France, England, and the Baltic countries in 1936, and to Switzerland, England, Belgium, Italy, France, Holland, and the Nordic countries during the uprising in 1947. He was a delegate in the Social Democratic Labour Party and the director of Lisebergs AB in Gothenburg. He was a member of the City Council since 1943, a member of the Finance Committee, Chairman of the Gothenburg City Vocational School, a member of the Board of Lisebergs AB, a substitute in Vingaböl, a member of the Board of Hotel AB Engelbrekt, and several others. His hobbies included fishing and traveling.

education.name: Nordic Folk High School in Geneva
